p.s: In the following text I am gonnagoing to tell you how the author tries to convince the readers of her opinion in the article Hope of escape lost in translation written by Zia Haider Rahman and published in The Sunday Times on the 17th December 2016.
In the first paragraph she tells us how important it is that the immigrants learn English and do not integrate alone.
This argument is proovedproved with facts how expensive translation is.
Later we get to know the bad conditions from Bangladesh.
She tells us her story and so it is easier to understand and identify with immigrants.
Additionally Zia makes the differences between the past and nowadays clear to strengthen her opinion.
In the last paragraph she underlines her opinion that you should not help immigrants totoo much so they can notcannot integrate and appeals to us how important it is to speak up and learn English.
There are many stylistic devices in the text.
For example an alliteration My parents (ll. 11-14).
Here it becomes clear how important the family is to immigrate.
Zia uses a metaphor But you don't learn to stand on your own two feet if someone is holding you up (ll. 18-19) to illustrate her opinion.
She also writes we and us (ll. 3, 18, 20, 23) many times.
This has the affect that it is easier to identify with the author and understand the text.
